events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on the highway during rush hour, resulting in front-end damage to their vehicle.
Insurance staff reviewed the initial report and classified the case under auto accident due to vehicle collision details provided.
An experienced claims agent has been assigned to manage the auto accident claim and assist the customer through the process.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim was received and is now being processed by the insurance company.
The agent requested the submission of the police accident report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed.
Customer provided all requested documents including police report, vehicle damage photos, and repair shop estimates promptly.
Claim investigation team has begun the verification process to assess liability and damage extent related to the automobile accident.
The investigation concluded confirming the customer was not at fault and the damage aligns with the reported collision incident.
A settlement offering full coverage for vehicle repairs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the customer for approval.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of their claim.
The claim was formally approved following customer agreement to the settlement terms and verification of all documentation.
Payment to cover all vehicle repair costs and rental expenses was issued successfully to the customerâ€™s account.
The auto accident claim was closed with all obligations met, and the customer was formally notified of closure.
